docs.lead_paragraph: It may just be the start of a new trend. The uninsured rate dropped modestly this month as expanded coverage rolled out under President Barack Obama's health care law, a major survey released Thursday has found.

headline.main: Poll: Uninsured Rate Drops as Health Law Rolls Out
headline.print_headline: Poll: Uninsured Rate Drops as Health Law Rolls Out

docs.snippet: It may just be the start of a new trend. The uninsured rate dropped modestly this month as expanded coverage rolled out under President Barack Obama's health care law, a major survey released Thursday has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: The man everybody loves to love is going to be greeting the American president in a matter of weeks. And we have a scandal already.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column submits that first meeting between Pres Obama and Pope Francis comes at interesting time for both men; points out Francis's popularity is exceedingly high while Obama's is low; holds Obama has been unfairly criticized for decision to move Vatican Embassy into more secure building, while Francis may be over-praised for simply behaving in appropriate manner for advocate of the poor.
docs.snippet: The man everybody loves to love is going to be greeting the American president in a matter of weeks. And we have a scandal already.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 6.3 million Americans were deemed eligible for government healthcare plans for the poor since the October 1 launch of President Barack Obama's healthcare law through December, federal officials reported on Wednesday.

headline.main: 6.3 Million Eligible for Medicaid Since Obamacare Launch: U.S. Agency
headline.print_headline: 6.3 Million Eligible for Medicaid Since Obamacare Launch: U.S. Agency

docs.snippet: More than 6.3 million Americans were deemed eligible for government healthcare plans for the poor since the October 1 launch of President Barack Obama's healthcare law through December, federal officials reported on Wednesday.

headline.main: Andreessen Horowitz Invests in Human Resources Firm Zenefits

docs.abstract: The start-up, whose cloud-based software helps small businesses manage compliance and human resources-related tasks, said on Wednesday that it had raised $15 million in a financing round.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge's decision to overturn Utah's same-sex marriage ban allowed Matthew Barraza and Tony Milner to do more than just get married. It opened the door for Milner to become legally recognized as the parent of their 4-year-old son.
